      • getReaderFromUrl

        public static java.io.BufferedReader getReaderFromUrl​(java.lang.String url)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns a Reader from a GET URL. It is the responsibility of the caller to close the Reader when done.
        Parameters:
        url -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getReaderFromUrl

        public static java.io.BufferedReader getReaderFromUrl​(java.lang.String url,
                                                      boolean retry)
        Returns a Reader from a GET URL. It is the responsibility of the caller to close the Reader when done. If retry is true, in the case of a failure, the HTTP call will be tried another 2 times with a delay of 1000 and 2500 respectively.
        Parameters:
        url -
        retry -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getReaderFromUrl

        public static java.io.BufferedReader getReaderFromUrl​(java.lang.String url,
                                                      boolean retry,
                                                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> headers)
        Returns a Reader from a GET URL and headers. It is the responsibility of the caller to close the Reader when done. If retry is true, in the case of a failure, the HTTP call will be tried another 2 times with a delay of 1000 and 2500 respectively.
        Parameters:
        url -
        retry -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • existsFileOrResource

        public static boolean existsFileOrResource​(java.lang.String Name)
        This methods provide a general "exists" helper that covers both file-system and resource-based paths.
        Parameters:
        Name -
        Returns:
        true if the resource was found either on the file system or in the classpath, or false otherwise.
